intro: Avenochloa agropyroides, commonly known as the false panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, two-lobed flowers. Avenochloa agropyroides is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and natural settings.
